com.woinject

Class InjectableApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.webobjects.appserver.WOApplication
      • er.extensions.appserver.ajax.ERXAjaxApplication
        • er.extensions.appserver.ERXApplication
          • com.woinject.InjectableApplication
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.webobjects.appserver.WOApplicationMBean, com.webobjects.foundation.NSKeyValueCoding, com.webobjects.foundation.NSKeyValueCoding.ErrorHandling, com.webobjects.foundation.NSKeyValueCodingAdditions, er.extensions.components.ERXGracefulShutdown.GracefulApplication

    public abstract class InjectableApplication
extends er.extensions.appserver.ERXApplication
    The InjectableApplication class is an extension of the ERXApplication that adds support for dependency injection to WebObjects applications. It automatically creates the Guice injector and initializes it with the WOInjectModule. Additional modules can be loaded by overriding the modules() method.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Henrique Prange
    See Also:
    Injector, WOInjectModule

    • Constructor Detail

      • InjectableApplication

        public InjectableApplication()
        Creates an instance of an InjectableApplication. The methods and fields annotated with the @Inject will be injected during the application construction. Constructor injection is not supported at the present time.
        See Also:
        Inject

    • Method Detail

      • application

        public static InjectableApplication application()

      • createInjector

        protected com.google.inject.Injector createInjector()
        Creates the injector to be used by the entire application.

        The WOInjectModule is loaded by default in addition to all the Modules returned by the modules() method.

        Override this method to create your own injector.

        Returns:
        The main Injector for the entire application
        See Also:
        Injector, WOInjectModule

      • injector

        public com.google.inject.Injector injector()
        Obtain the injector created for this application.
        Returns:
        The injector created during this application initialization

      • modules

        protected com.google.inject.Module[] modules()
        Override this method to inform what Modules should be loaded by the injector during the initialization phase.
        Returns:
        An array of Modules to be loaded when creating the injector
        See Also:
        createInjector(), Module

      • stage

        protected com.google.inject.Stage stage()
        Obtain the Stage in which the application is running. This stage is to be used by the injector. Override this method to inform
        Returns:
        See Also:
        Stage
